concept.title: LDAP Security
concept.shortdesc: This topic explains variables in the LIC file you should use to secure configuration.
concept.conbody:
When you enable LDAP/Active Directory (AD) integration with Eucalyptus, we recommend that you use the following variables in the LDAP/AD Integration Configuration (LIC) file. These variables are located under the ldap-service element in the LIC file.
Element Description
auth-method The LDAP/AD authentication method to perform synchronization.
simple: for clear text user/password authentication.
DIGEST-MD5: for SASL authentication using MD5
GSSAPI: SASL authentication using Kerberos V5.
user-auth-method The LDAP/AD authentication method for normal users to perform Eucalyptus Administrator Console login.
simple: for clear text user/password authentication.
DIGEST-MD5: for SASL authentication using MD5
GSSAPI: SASL authentication using Kerberos V5.
use-ssl Specifies whether to use SSL for connecting to LDAP/AD service. If this option is enabled, make sure the SSL port for LDAP is defined as part of the server-url. The default port for LDAP+SSL is port 636.
ignore-ssl-cert-validation Specifies whether to ignore self-signed SSL certs. This is useful when you only have self-signed SSL certs for your LDAP/AD services.
krb5-conf The file path for krb5.conf, if you use GSSAPI authentication method.
Please note the following:
auth-method and user-auth-method support three types of authentication methods: simple: for clear text user/password authentication. This should only be used if use-ssl is enabled. Currently Eucalyptus only supports ldap+SSL (ldaps). TLS [http://www.openldap.org/doc/admin24/tls.html] is planned to be supported in the future. DIGEST-MD5: SASL authentication using MD5 GSSAPI: SASL authentication using Kerberos V5
For more information about simple authentication, go to the following resources:
OpenLDAP - Authentication Methods - "simple" method [http://www.openldap.org/doc/admin24/security.html#"simple‚Äù method]
Active Directory - Simple Authentication [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc223499.aspx]
For more information regarding using SASL authentication, go to the following resources:
OpenLDAP - Using SASL [http://www.openldap.org/doc/admin24/sasl.html]
Active Directory - SASL Authentication [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc223500.aspx]
* When use-ssl is enabled, this means that ldaps will be used. The server-url still needs to begin with ldap://.
*
We recommend using a proxy user for the auth-principal. Typically, proxy users are used to be associated with the application that needs to do reads (and in some cases writes) against the LDAP/AD Directory. Proxy users also help make it easier for security audits done on the LDAP/AD Directory. For the proxy user used with Eucalyptus for LDAP/AD sync, the proxy user only needs read access. For more information about using proxy authentication with OpenLDAP and Active Directory, please refer to the following resources:
OpenLDAP - SASL Proxy Authorization [http://www.openldap.org/doc/admin24/sasl.html#SASL Proxy Authorization]
Active Directory - Support Types of Security Principles [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc223505.aspx]
For more information about security regarding OpenLDAP and Active Directory, refer to the following resources:
OpenLDAP - Security Considerations [http://www.openldap.org/doc/admin24/security.html]
Active Directory - LDAP Security [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc223496.aspx]
